      • signRequest

        public void signRequest(org.scribe.model.Token accessToken,
                        org.scribe.model.OAuthRequest request)
        Signs a request.

        This method appends the access token into the request, according to the configured signature type.

        It supports two signature types:

        • SignatureType.Header
        • SignatureType.QueryString

        SignatureType.Header: Appends "BEARER" token as an authentication header.

        SignatureType.QueryString: Append "oauth_token" as a query string parameter.

        Specified by:
        signRequest in interface org.scribe.oauth.OAuthService

      • getAuthorizationUrl

        public java.lang.String getAuthorizationUrl(org.scribe.model.Token requestToken)

        Same as getAuthorizationUrl()

        Specified by:
        getAuthorizationUrl in interface org.scribe.oauth.OAuthService
        Parameters:
        requestToken - Access token.
        Returns:
        the URL where you should redirect your users.
        See Also:
        TrueNTHOAuthProvider.getAuthorizationUrl(TrueNTHOAuthConfig)

      • getAuthorizationUrl

        public java.lang.String getAuthorizationUrl()
        Returns the redirection URL where users authenticate.
        Returns:
        the URL where you should redirect your users.
        See Also:
        TrueNTHOAuthProvider.getAuthorizationUrl(TrueNTHOAuthConfig)

      • getAuthorizationUrl

        public java.lang.String getAuthorizationUrl(int numberEncodings,
                                            org.scribe.model.ParameterList callbackParameters,
                                            org.scribe.model.ParameterList parameters)
        Returns the redirection URL.
        Parameters:
        numberEncodings - Number of encoding operations to be applied on the callback URL. Two encoding operations are necessary to communicate properly with CS after browser redirections in POP UPs.
        callbackParameters - Additional parameters to add with the callback URL. This parameter list will be added to the callback URL. Those parameters are destined to the callback target.
        parameters - Additional parameters to add on the Authorization URL. This parameter list should be used for especial circumstances to fine tune requests directed to the the OAuth server; for instance CS's "next" parameter. Parameters coming form the OAuthConfig will be automatically appended (by the provider); such as "scope".
        Returns:
        the URL where users will be redirected.

      • getAuthorizationUrl

        public java.lang.String getAuthorizationUrl(int numberEncodings,
                                            org.scribe.model.ParameterList callbackParameters)
        Returns the redirection URL.

        This is just a convenience method. Same as: getAuthorizationUrl(int, ParameterList, ParameterList)

        Parameters:
        numberEncodings - Number of encoding operations to be applied on the callback URL. Two encoding operations are necessary to communicate properly with CS after browser redirections in POP UPs.
        callbackParameters - Additional parameters to add with the callback URL. This parameter list will be added to the callback URL. Those parameters are destined to the callback target.
        Returns:
        the URL where users will be redirected.

      • getRolesURL

        public java.lang.String getRolesURL(long userId)
        Returns the configured roles URL, for a specific user.

        Replaces the userId place holder the the String representation of the TrueNTH user ID.

        Parameters:
        userId - TrueNTH User ID.
        Returns:
        Roles URL.

      • getResourceURL

        Returns:

      • getBaseURL

        public java.lang.String getBaseURL()
        Returns the configured Central Services' base URL.

        This URL points to central services base URL, it should not be used for OAuth operation, but for fetching static resources, such as css. It is mainly used for templates.

        Returns:
        Configured Central Services base URL.
